Job Description
I. BASIC FUNCTIONS OF THE JOB:
Work as a member of a Radar System Software development team to develop Command and Control Interfaces,
Real-time system control code, Radar Subsystem development, Range Control System and Graphics Package development. Candidate will develop code and unit tests to a documented design. In addition to the above activities the candidate will assist in other basic Software Engineering activities such as peer reviews, code reviews, and Software configuration management.
II. PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: (Duties and responsibilities which occupy a major portion of time and importance in the job. Incumbent(s) perform one or more of the following duties.)
1. Assists in development and evaluation of moderately complex software designs to reduce/identify design flaws that would cause defects.
2. Assists in preparing design documentation for moderately complex software designs in accordance with established software development processes and procedures.
3. Codes and unit tests moderately complex software units to a documented design.
4. Assist in the preparation of software engineering change orders, change proposals and corrective action reports.
5. Assist in evaluations/trade studies for software development tools.
6. Will follow the direction of Lead Software Engineer to Develop Radar System and Range Control System software components.

Typical Education & Experience

Typically a Bachelor's Degree and 2 years work experience or equivalent experience

Required Skills and Education
Typically a Bachelor's Degree and 2 years work experience or equivalent experience

Degree must be in Computer Engineering and or Computer Science.

Must have at least 1 to 3 years of experience with programming in C, or C++.

Background in real-time embedded systems with Emphasis in Command and Control interfaces desired as well as a basic understanding of physics and network programming
